benchmark_details.name: BENCH HUB (A Unified Benchmark Suite for Holistic and Customizable LLM Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: BENCH HUB is a dynamic benchmark repository that empowers researchers and developers to evaluate LLMs more effectively by aggregating and automatically classifying benchmark datasets from diverse domains, covering a total of 303K questions from 38 benchmarks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a unified benchmark suite for holistic and customizable evaluation of large language models across multiple domains.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Incomplete English Dataset Coverage: Due to the vast amount of English-language data, not all relevant datasets could be included.

data.annotation: Automated categorization using a fine-tuned model.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are derived from evaluating model performance across categorized subsets.
methodology.interpretation: Results are interpreted based on domain-specific performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Results from model evaluations across benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Statistical validation through various sampling strategies.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The whole dataset is released under CC BY-NC-ND 4.0.
